intro: Lepidaploa grisea, commonly known as the gray lepidaploa, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its silver-gray foliage, which gives it its common name. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers that are typically pale yellow to white in color. It is native to certain regions of South America, particularly in Argentina and Chile. Lepidaploa grisea is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
